question: Which among the following statements is correct?
option1: Blood type O has O antigens on the surface of the red blood cells.
option2: Blood type A has A antibodies circulating in the plasma.
option3: The danger in a transfusion is if the donor has antibodies to the recipient.
option4: A and B antigens are on the surface of the red blood cells.
answer: A and B antigens are on the surface of the red blood cells.
explanation: Blood type O has no antigens on the red blood cells. Blood type A has A antigens on the surface of the red blood cells and B antibodies circulating in the plasma. Type O is the universal donor because it has no antigens on the surface of the red blood cells to be clumped by the recipientâ€™s antibodies.
